name: French
descriptions: TCU's French Studies program emphasizes global engagement through language, literature, history, and culture. Students explore French-speaking and Francophone regions across Europe, the Caribbean, Africa, North America, Oceania, and Asia, developing critical thinking, emotional intelligence, and effective communication in French.

French reaches over 300 million speakers across 29 countries as an official language. Graduates demonstrate exceptional post-graduation placement in medical school, law school, graduate programs, K-12 education, and business careers including internships in Paris.

courses: MOLA 20003 - Cosmopolitanism: Thinking from a Global Perspective - 3 hrs. (gateway)

electiveCourses.description: Three courses taught in French at the 30000+ level (at least one at 40000+), plus two courses with ARAB, CHIN, FREN, GRMN, ITAL, JAPN, or MOLA prefix (max one taught in English). May include one interdisciplinary course with advisor approval.
